required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Measurement of Eye Movements While Reading a German Text
clinical_study.official_title: Measurement of Eye Movements While Reading a German Text

brief_summary.textblock: To establish normative value for reading parameters in healthy children of primary school age and in grades 2-5.

detailed_description.textblock: Following initial assessment of feasibility, recruitment is expanded to children attending grades 2-5 recruited from 4 different primary schools in German speaking Switzerland. Two texts of The New International Reading Speed Test (IReST) of similar difficulty are presented on a laptop in randomized order. Children are asked to read the text aloud while eye movements are recorded with an eye tracking bar. The following parameters are analysed: reading speed (words/minute), number of saccades, number of fixations.

primary_outcome.description: how stable are the eyes while reading out loud

arm_group.description: Primary school children are asked to read a German text presented on a laptop screen

intervention.description: Reading of 2 IRest Texts presented on a laptop in randomized order while eye movements are recorded with a tracking bar.

study_pop.textblock: children recruited from 4 primary schools in German speaking Switzerland

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 8-13 years
- child consent
- parental consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- unability to read

overall_official.affiliation: University Basel, University Eye Hospital Basel

facility.name: University Basel, University Eye Hospital Basel

results_reference.citation: Wertli J, Sch√∂tzau A, Trauzettel-Klosinski S, Palmowski-Wolfe A. Feasibility of Eye Movement Recordings with the SMI Tracking Bar in 10- to 11-Year-Old Children Performing a Reading Task. Klin Monbl Augenheilkd. 2020 Apr;237(4):510-516. doi: 10.1055/a-1101-9204. Epub 2020 Apr 24.
